titleInfo.title: Isabel M. Herson oral history interview

subject.geographic: Southern University and A & M College

mods.abstract: Herson describes herself as an honor student active in school clubs, academics, and athletics. She describes several classmates, faculty members, an average day, dress codes, codes of conduct, and McKinley High School's contribution to students, the community, and history of Baton Rouge. Herson describes her life experiences after leaving McKinley, reflects on the foundation she received there, and leaves words of wisdom for aspiring McKinley graduates.
mods.note: This collection includes materials accessioned as Mss. 4700.0617; A digital version of the transcript (pdf) exists for duplication purposes; A digital version of the audio recording (mp3) exists for duplication purposes and public access in the Special Collections Reading Room; Interview conducted by Shawnda Hollins and Petra Munro.

Isabel M. Herson was born in Baton Rouge, La., on September 23, 1910 to Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Morgan. She was part of the first class to graduate from McKinley High School after attending a full school year in 1928. She was a teacher and served as Chairman of the Department of Elementary Education at Southern University.
